citation.article-title: Descriptions of Actinoplanes ianthinogenes nom. rev. and Actinoplanes octamycinicus corrig. comb. nov., nom. rev.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinoplanes octamycinicus corrig. comb. nov., nom. rev.

Actinoplanes octamycinicus [oc.ta.my.ci′ni.cus. N.L. n. octamycinum octamycin (name of an antibiotic); L. masc. suff. -icus suffix used with the sense of pertaining to; N.L. masc. adj. octamycinicus pertaining to octamycin, in reference to octamycin production].
The description of this species is based on data reported by Gauze et al. (1979) and data obtained in this study.
The substrate mycelium is orange, yellow or brown.
Aerial mycelium is absent and vegetative mycelium has branched hyphae.

Sporangia on short sporangiophores arising from the vegetative mycelium, which is formed abundantly on oatmeal agar and humic acid-vitamin agar, are globose with an irregular surface and 3.0–10.0 µm in diameter.
Sporangial release is observed after rupture of the sporangial wall.
Grows at 15–37 °C, at pH 6–9 and in a maximum NaCl concentration of 1 %.

N-Acetylglucosamine, aesculin ferric citrate, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, gluconate, d-glucose, glycerol, glycogen, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, d-sorbitol, starch, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose can be utilized as sole carbon sources.

Positive for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, catalase, aesculin hydrolysis, esterase lipase (C8), gelatin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, leucine aminopeptidase, nitrate reduction, phosphohydrolase, pyrazinamidase, trypsin and valine aminopeptidase.
The major fatty acid is iso-C16 : 0 and the major menaquinone is MK-9(H4).

The polar lipid profile contains diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and an unknown polar lipid as major components but lacks phosphatidylcholine and aminoglycolipids (phospholipid type PII).
Additionally, moderate amounts of phosphatidylinositol are detected.
The type strain is NBRC 14524T ( = INA 4041T = ATCC 43632T = JCM 9649T = KCTC 9593T).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 72.1 mol% (determined by HPLC).
